sectionText: Topic section ONG: America at the Nadir: Race and Representation from Twain to Hurston This course will use a multi-disciplinary approach to explore the perceived role, or ?place,? of blacks and other marginalzied groups (including women and the poor) in US society as it was represented in popular forms of expression, such as literature, film, theater and music at the turn of the twentieth century. We will begin with cultural production from the Reconstruction and progress through the Harlem Renaissance and explore such themes as identity and representation; ?black face? minstrelsy; ?manifest destiny? and modernity; etc. Section ONG is a 2nd 8 week, online section. This class has a mandatory once weekly discussion section at either 9-10:30 am or 6-7:30 pm on Thursdays.
